Reviews.Title: “Great location, not great hostel”
Reviews.Author: Alix W Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location wise this hostel is brilliant- Glebe is a fantastic place to stay while in Sydney- there are cafes galore and lots of second hand book shops and every type of restaurant you could possibly want. You can walk to the city and Darling harbour and there are buses right outside the hostel too which only cost $2 to get into the CBD. The hostel is kept clean but on first impressions it is dissapointing to say the least. The rooms are a lot smaller and more camped than we thought they would be. There is only a tiny window that opens so the room smells musty and stale..which also means after a while so do your clothes. Storage is ok in the rooms and you have a cupboard in the kitchen. Utensils are very basic- no colanders or graters or anything and we shared one knife between four of us for the three months we were there. The biggest problem we had with this hostel was our room mates...the mangers take no time in considering who shares a room and consequently we were with a guy who was around 50 and had been in the room for a year and a half. We get on with everyone but this really did put a dampener on our stay. Our air con didnt work for the whole time we stayed there despite being told it was "being fixed in 2 weeks time" every week- complaining about it did no good so we just made do with a plug in fan which did very little. Reception staff are generally unhelpful, unapproachable and couldnt care less as long as you hand over rent each week. Free laundry usage is great when you can get a free machine which is mostly during the week while everyone is out at work. Being free is a huge bonus though as most other hostels will charge at least $4 for the washing and another $4 for the dryer. I wouldnt stay here again as we spent most weeks looking for other places to stay..but in saying that we couldnt find a cheaper option in Sydney so sort of got stuck there. Location wise its ideal and price wise its excellent...maybe next time i'd extend the budget though. Couldn't recommend staying in Glebe more though.

Reviews.Title: “I've had some time to think about this: worst hostel around.”
Reviews.Author: Shaun L
Reviews.Content: I've had some time to consider writing this and have stayed in a couple of hostels since. All things considered, this hostel is the worst I have ever seen. I won't say 'stayed at' because we left without spending the night there. The rooms are far more filthy than the pictures would have you believe. Ours had large stains on the carpet, smelled of urine, had hundreds of cigarette butts jammed into the window sill, stained mattresses, the bathroom tiles looked like they had never been cleaned, several tiles were missing or broken and were sharp and dangerous, the television didn't work, the remote controls for the air conditioning and the television had no batteries and the fridge was filthy and smelled awful. We had booked over the phone and paid when we had done that, but upon viewing the room we returned immediately to reception and asked for a refund as we decided not to stay. The staff refused to refund us and showed no concern for our distress over the state of the room. They said "well it's an old building and it's just a backpackers". Well to be honest, for the same price we could have stayed at the YHA which is a 5 star hotel compared to this place, the only reason we didn't stay there was that we couldn't get a booking. I decided that driving back to Canberra in the middle of the night would be preferable to risking my health and well being by sleeping in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hostel - Shame about the bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Tot87
Reviews.Content: This hostel has the potential to be wicked. Its in a fab location - Glebe is an awesome places, really quirky and cool. And its close to the city centre (just a 30min slow walk) and train station (10mins max). The facilities are fairly decent, the kitchen could so with a spruce and they need to seriously sort out some a/c in there coz in summer it gets stiffling. The rooms are good, the a/c and free interent are a brill feature for a cheap hostel. But after all that they are in complete denial about bedbugs. I stayed there for 3 months and after a month or so started noticing bites all over my body. Being a new traveller I thought it was just mozzies until the bites startd getting worse and worse. I told the manager about the bites and she just shrugged it off telling me that shed had bed bugs and there was no way my bites were due to them. She did change my matress thou and i went crazy with the bug spray. However the bugs were still biting and I even caught one crawling on my belly!! I told the manager and NOTHING! And as I was checking out I heard the manager talking on the phone saying that they had bed bugs in another property and so were moving all the tenants to Rooftop! This is just asking for trouble! Overall I had a good time here. some of the long term people there are complete idiots but I met a good bunch of people and apart from constantly itching I had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pfish61
Reviews.Content: This hotel was neat and clean and affordable. It was right near the train station and centrally located so you could walk just about everywhere. We were able to walk to the Botanical Gardens on several occassions, which are absolutely beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities and view, poor service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Kendo2
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Rooftop Travellers Lodge from mid October until beginning of November as we started our trip in Australia. The room was nice for a hostel and had a lot of amenities with a TV, DVD player, PC and free Internet, a fridge and freezer and an ensuite bathroom with a shower all in the room (although the shower frequently floods your bathroom). The kitchen was usually clean, you get your own cupboard to store your dry food and there were a lot of stoves, ovens and microwaves available. However, the stove knobs to turn the gas on and off were often missing and due to the kitchen being on the roof and the fridge being in the room you have to transfer all your food up several stairs. The hostel also offered free laundry machines (washing and dryer), but the laundry room was downright filthy with water dripping from the ceiling and other guests would remove your laundry from the machines to be able to use them. Staff were quite friendly, but also indifferent to your problems, but not much to expect as they are mostly all ex-backpackers. Also, the air conditioning in the room was broken. Not so bad when we stayed but in the summer it could get very, very hot. The noise was sometimes very annoying with people running around in the hallways. The stench of weed was also nearly always present anywhere in the hostel (no matter if you were in your room or on the roof). As for location, it's good for the money. You're no more than a 15-20 minute walk from the CBD and a major shopping centre is nearby. All in all, it's a nice hostel, but don't expect the world.

Reviews.Title: “A palace”
Reviews.Author: R3GiMentMan
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hostel in the area. We have stayed at hostels all over the world and this one was by far the best we have seen in a long time. The facilities are great, comfortable beds, airco and free internet, you couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “um....next!”
Reviews.Author: gleeglee
Reviews.Content: PUTRID! rooms + toilets filthy, halls filthy,rooms airless and filthy,broken doors,wobbly beds,kitchens putrid,the good thing about this place is the view from the top floor.cheap but filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Made my time in Australia! Excellent”
Reviews.Author: amzjp
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here from Sept 2008 until February 2009. The rooms are perfect compared to other hostels. Great for long-termers / working people. Each room has 4 beds in, en-suite, fridge, freezer, tv, dvd, pc with 24/7 free internet!, wardrobes, draws (plenty of storage), sink, kettle, food shelves, air-con. Laundry facilities, free car-park. You clean your own rooms so they are as clean as you want them to be, people who complain about the rooms being dirty, well they should have cleaned them then! The price is excellent, $120 a week if you are there for 6 weeks or more. You actually get a quilt, where as in all the other hostels I've stayed in you get a poxy sheet. The hostel itself is basic, there is a common room with a tv in, a rooftop which is brilliant where the kitchen is. Only downside is that the rooftop/kitcehn shuts at 9pm. I would def recommend it to other travellors staying long-term in Sydney. Glebe is an excellent place to stay, within walking distance of the city and bus is less than $2 with a bus stop right outside the hostel. Reception is open between 8am-8pm, staff are nice and friendly. Not unreasonable. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all Costs”
Reviews.Author: Alex177
Reviews.Content: The rooms are absolutely filthy. We were put there by our study abroad program and had no choice but to stay once we arrived. We had a mold spot in our bathroom that they simply painted over. Our room had bed bugs and they told us they could spray and kill "half of them." The only plus was they left all the gear in the room from the previous guests and I picked up a copy of "101 Easy Songs to Play on Guitar." Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug87
Reviews.Content: Do not expect to get any sleep there, all night parties with lots of drinking, shouting and brawling. Give it a miss unless you are an all night owl and boozer

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLY NOISY”
Reviews.Author: Lapdog
Reviews.Content: If you want a good night's sleep, don't stay here. Its full of backpackers partying all night long (Friday night until 3.30am), families with noisy kids running up and down stairwells to the rooftop patio. The new management do not adhere to the supposed curfew at night. The onsite security is inadequate at night. People bang doors consistently as the doors have inadequate mechanisms for closing quietly. Pity because its central and the rooftop kitchen and bbq area is a bonus if you want to cater for yourself. We have not had a decent night's sleep in this place for several nights and so stressed its unbelievable. The staff are sympathetic and friendly but it doesn't make any difference, the noise levels just don't stop. We are stuck having paid 2 weeks in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Radical”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Close to everything you need, not to expensive, nice staff and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing that is missing is a lift”
Reviews.Author: WaveKat
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel this is a wonderful find. The room was spacious, with a microwave and fridge and a computer in the room for surfing the web. The bathroom was shower only but still great. The staff were wonderful and very helpful and the area is perfect for those touring Sydney. The MAJOR drawback is that the check in is one floor up and the rooms above that... and no elevator! Can be a real chore if you have heavy bags. The rooftop was being renovated, but the view from up there is still spectacular. Looking forward to staying again... with less luggage.
